data.title: University of Houston Athletics
data.meta_description: Zion Taylor (50) DOG - High School Three-star prospect by 247, ESPN and rivals Ranked No. 93 EDGE player nationally according to 247Sports Ranked No. 192 pla...
data.text:
High School

Three-star prospect by 247, ESPN and rivals

Ranked No. 93 EDGE player nationally according to 247Sports

Ranked No. 192 player in Texas according to 247Sports

For his career: 72 tackles, 50 solo stops, 15.5 sacks and 20 quarterback hurries

24.5 tackles for loss in 28 career games played

20+ tackles, 15+ solo stops and 7+ TFLs in all three seasons at Shadow Creek

Career high 28 tackles and 9.5 tackles for loss across 10 games in 2023

2022 Texas District 23-6A First Team All-District

Helped Sharks to undefeated regular season and area playoffs in 2022

2021 Texas District 23-6A Defensive Newcomer of Year as sophomore

20 tackles, 8 TFLs and four sacks in nine games in 2021

Played 2020 freshman season at Fort Bend Ridge Point

Also competed in shot put, posting mark of 37 feet, 8 inches, as a sophomore

Personal

Nickname: Big Smooth

Hobbies: going to church and finishing

Previously played with Maurice Williams III for three years at Shadow Creek

Dream job outside of football: pro fisherman

Something most people donâ€™t know: loves finishing

Hidden talent: finishing

Brother Brandon Bell played football at New Mexico State

Brother DePriest Taylor played at Prairie View A&M

Chose UH because of the culture and Coach Fritz

One word to describe himself on the field: killer

If he could eat one food for the rest of his life: hot wings

Biggest motivation for working hard: his mother

Highlight of his life thus far: Jesus

Best advice: only the strong survive

Sports hero: Jesus for saving him

Most memorable athletic feat: being selected for U.S. Army Bowl

Unique fact: is youngest child
